title: Index of Consumption of Raw Cotton for Great Britain
notes:
Series Is Presented Here As Two Variables--(1)--Seasonally Adjusted, 1920-1936 (2)--Seasonally Adjusted, 1924-1939, Data Were Based On Deliveries Of Cotton To Spinners In Pounds, On A Daily Average Basis. Seasonal Coefficients, Instead Of Being Based As In Old Index On A Uniform Calculated On A Years Up To And Including The Year Previous To That For Which The Indices Are Calculated. The Seasonal Fluctuations Have Been Eliminated. Source: The Economist, Supplement Of June 29, 1935, P. 45; Supplement Of June 27, 1936, P. 19.

This NBER data series m01197a appears on the NBER website in Chapter 1 at http://www.nber.org/databases/macrohistory/contents/chapter01.html.

NBER Indicator: m01197a
